docblock.description: The wrapper class for a Maileon schedule. This class wraps the XML structure.

tag.name: author
tag.description: Marcus St&auml;nder

tag.name: var
tag.description: minute The schedule minutes in the format MM

tag.name: var
tag.description: hours The schedule hour in the format of HH, 24 hours format

tag.name: var
tag.description: state The state of the schedule

tag.name: var
tag.description: date The SQL conform date of the schedule day in the format YYYY-MM-DD

tag.name: var
tag.description: dispatchOption The time distribution strategy to choose from {'hour', 'weekdayhour', 'uniform'}.

tag.name: var
tag.description: dispatchEndInHours Number of hours begining from the dispatch start util which the dispatch distribution over the time has to be finished. Used in case of 'hour' dispatch option and 'uniform' option. Allowed values for the 'uniform' distribution are in [2..96], whereas for 'hour' strategy thery are ranging from [2..24].

tag.name: var
tag.description: dispatchEndInDays Number of days begining from the dispatch start util which the dispatch distribution over the time has to be finished. Used only with dispatch option 'weekdayhour' and its acceptable range is [1..7].

tag.name: var
tag.description: dispatchEndExactDatetime The exact end date util which the dispatch time distribution has to be finished. It is used when none of the arguments above dispatchEndInHours, dispatchEndInDays aren't set i.e. equals 0. Note that one of dispatchEndInHours, dispatchEndInDays, dispatchEndExactDatetime argument should be used in the request according to the selected dispatch option. Format: yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm

tag.name: var
tag.description: clicksAsResponseReference The parameter determines the inclusion/exclusion of clicks as a response criteria when selecting {'hour', 'weekdayhour'} options.

tag.name: var
tag.description: dispatchWavesGroup The number determines how many consecutive sending waves will be grouped when using {'hour', 'weekdayhour'} distribution. Supported values are {1, 2, 3 (default)}.

tag.name: var
tag.description: dispatchUniformInterval The arguments controls the interval {'hour', '30m', '20m', '15m', '10m'} for the 'uniform' strategy indicating the frequency of mailing distribution over time. It should equals null for {'hour', 'weekdayhour'} dispatch options.

tag.name: var
tag.description: allowedHours The value represents the allowed hours. Comma separated values for the allowed hours and can be combined with a range of hours. The required format looks like 0,3,5,17-21 as an example. The acceptable values rane is 0..23. Note that the if this argument is not provided, all 24H of the day will be considered as acceptable dispatch hours.

docblock.description: Constructor initializing values.

tag.name: param
tag.description: minute The schedule minutes in the format MM

tag.name: param

tag.description: date The SQL conform date of the schedule day in the format YYYY-MM-DD

Allowed values for the 'uniform' distribution are in [2..96], whereas for 'hour' strategy thery are ranging from [2..24].

tag.name: param

tag.name: param

It is used when none of the arguments above dispatchEndInHours, dispatchEndInDays aren't set i.e. equals 0. Note that one of dispatchEndInHours, dispatchEndInDays, dispatchEndExactDatetime argument should be used in the request according to the selected dispatch option. Format: yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm

tag.name: param
tag.description: clicksAsResponseReference The parameter determines the inclusion/exclusion of clicks as a response criteria when selecting {'hour', 'weekdayhour'} options.

tag.name: param
tag.description: dispatchWavesGroup The number determines how many consecutive sending waves will be grouped when using {'hour', 'weekdayhour'} distribution. Supported values are {1, 2, 3 (default)}.

tag.name: param
tag.description: dispatchUniformInterval The arguments controls the interval {'hour', '30m', '20m', '15m', '10m'} for the 'uniform' strategy indicating the frequency of mailing distribution over time. It should equals null for {'hour', 'weekdayhour'} dispatch options.

tag.name: param
tag.description: allowedHours The value represents the allowed hours. Comma separated values for the allowed hours and can be combined with a range of hours. The required format looks like 0,3,5,17-21 as an example. The acceptable values rane is 0..23. tag.name: param
tag.description: If provided, only the openers after the given date will be returned. The value of from_date must be a numeric value representing a point in time milliseconds afterJanuary 1, 1970 00:00:00

tag.name: param
tag.description: If provided, only the openers before the given date will be returned. The value of to_date must be a numeric value representing a point in time milliseconds afterJanuary 1, 1970 00:00:00

tag.name: param
tag.description: Multivalued parameter to filter the openers by mailings. Each value must correspond to a mailing id.

tag.description: Multivalued parameter to filter the opens by the social networks where they occurred.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Multivalued parameter to filter the opens by device type. Possible values for device_type are: UNKNOWN / COMPUTER / TABLET / MOBILE

tag.name: param
tag.description: If the set to true, available email client details will be appended to each open.

tag.name: param
tag.description: If this is set to true (default), only openers that have not yet been anonymized (due to deletion/unsubscription) are returned.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The list of standard contact fields to return.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The list of custom contact fields to return.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Supported values: true / false. Field Backups are the values of contact fields that have been backed up for mailings because of a backup instruction. For each unsubscription, the corresponding field backups will be returned if available. Note that this only applies for non anonymizable field backups.

tag.description: The index of the result page. The index must be greater or equal to 1.

tag.description: The maximum count of items in the result page. If provided, the value of page_size must be in the range 1 to 1000.

Creates or updates a contact and optionally triggers a double opt-in (doi) process.
docblock.long-description: Note that none of the attributes is required.

tag.name: param
tag.description: the contact to create or update; if no permission is set, the Maileon default permission "NONE" will be used

tag.name: param
tag.description: the synchronization mode to employ

tag.name: param
tag.description: A string intended to describe the source of the contact. If provided, the string will be stored with the doi process.

tag.name: param
tag.description: In case where this method was called by a subscription page, this string offers the possibility to keep track of it for use in reports.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Tells whether a double opt-in process should be started for the created contact. Note that the status code returned for this request does not mean that the doi process succeeded.

tag.name: param
tag.description: This parameter is ignored if doi is not provided or false. In case the doi process succeeds, Maileon will be allowed to track opens and clicks of the contact.

tag.name: param
tag.description: This parameter is ignored if doi is not provided or false. References the doi mailing to be used. If not provided, the default doi mailing will be used.

tag.description: the result object of the API call

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if there was a connection problem or a server error occurred

tag.name: param
tag.description: This parameter is ignored if doi is not provided or false. In case the doi process succeeds, Maileon will be allowed to track opens and clicks of the contact.

docblock.description: The result of making a call to the Maileon REST API.
docblock.long-description:
This class encapsulates the technical details of the REST API's HTTP response. In order to retrieve the payload result in deserialized form, just call com_maileon_api_MaileonAPIResult::getResult().
However, this class also allows the underlying HTTP response information to be queried, including the returned status code (com_maileon_api_MaileonAPIResult::getStatusCode()) and content type (com_maileon_api_MaileonAPIResult::getContentType()) as well as the raw HTTP response body data (com_maileon_api_MaileonAPIResult::getBodyData()).

docblock.description: Creates a new result object from the curl response and session data.

tag.name: param
tag.description: the HTTP response data, null if there was none

tag.name: param
tag.description: the cURL session that was used

tag.name: param
tag.description: if true, an exception will be thrown in case of a connection or server error

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the class this result should be deserialized as. Use array( 'array', 'typename' ) to deserialize arrays of a type.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if $throwException == true and there was a connection problem or a server error occurred

tag.name: return
tag.description: the deserialized result object as a subclass of com_maileon_api_xml_AbstractXMLWrapper, or the free-form string result if the response body data was not a deserializable object, or null if there was no response body data

tag.name: return
tag.description: the HTTP status code that was returned by the HTTP request

tag.name: return
tag.description: true iff a 2xx status code (success) was returned by the HTTP request

tag.name: return
tag.description: true iff a 4xx status code (client error) was returned by the HTTP request

tag.name: return
tag.description: the content type returned by the HTTP request

tag.name: return
tag.description: the unprocessed HTTP body data, or null if there was no body

tag.name: return
tag.description: the HTTP body data parsed as a SimpleXMLElement, or null if there was no XML in the body

tag.name: return
tag.description: of strings an array of response headers

tag.name: return
tag.description: a human-readable representation of the HTTP request result

docblock.description: Method to retrieve mailingy by scheduling time

tag.name: param
tag.description: This is a date and time string that defines the filter for a mailing. The mailings before and after that time can be queried, see beforeSchedulingTime. The format is the standard SQL date: yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss

tag.name: param
tag.description: (default = true) If true, the mailings before the given time will be returned, if false, the mailings at or after the given time will be returned.

tag.name: param
tag.description: fields (default = empty) This list contains the fields that shall be returned with the result. If this list is empty, only the IDs will be returned. Valid fields are: state, type, name, and scheduleTime

tag.name: param
tag.description: page_index (default = 1) The index of the result page. The index must be greater or equal to 1.

tag.name: param
tag.description: page_size (default = 100) The maximum count of items in the result page. If provided, the value of page_size must be in the range 1 to 1000.

tag.name: param
tag.description: orderBy (default = id) The field to order results by

tag.name: param
tag.description: order (default = DESC) The order

docblock.description: Schedules the mailing to be instantly sent

tag.name: param
tag.description: mailingId The ID of the mailing to send now

docblock.description: Schedules the mailing for a given time. If dispatchOption is set, the enhanced scheduling options are enabled.

tag.name: param
tag.description: mailingId The ID of the mailing to schedule

tag.name: param
tag.description: date The SQL conform date of the schedule day in the format YYYY-MM-DD

tag.name: param
tag.description: hours The schedule hour in the format of HH, 24 hours format

tag.name: param
tag.description: minute The schedule minutes in the format MM

tag.name: param
tag.description: dispatchOption The time distribution strategy to choose from {'hour', 'weekdayhour', 'uniform'}.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Number of hours begining from the dispatch start util which the dispatch distribution over the time has to be finished. Used in case of 'hour' dispatch option and 'uniform' option. Allowed values for the 'uniform' distribution are in [2..96], whereas for 'hour' strategy thery are ranging from [2..24].

tag.name: param
tag.description: Number of days begining from the dispatch start util which the dispatch distribution over the time has to be finished. Used only with dispatch option 'weekdayhour' and its acceptable range is [1..7].

tag.name: param
tag.description: The exact end date util which the dispatch time distribution has to be finished. It is used when none of the arguments above dispatchEndInHours, dispatchEndInDays aren't set i.e. equals 0. Note that one of dispatchEndInHours, dispatchEndInDays, dispatchEndExactDatetime argument should be used in the request according to the selected dispatch option. Format: yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm

tag.name: param
tag.description: clicksAsResponseReference The parameter determines the inclusion/exclusion of clicks as a response criteria when selecting {'hour', 'weekdayhour'} options.

tag.name: param
tag.description: dispatchWavesGroup The number determines how many consecutive sending waves will be grouped when using {'hour', 'weekdayhour'} distribution. Supported values are {1, 2, 3 (default)}.

tag.name: param
tag.description: dispatchUniformInterval The arguments controls the interval {'hour', '30m', '20m', '15m', '10m'} for the 'uniform' strategy indicating the frequency of mailing distribution over time. It should equals null for {'hour', 'weekdayhour'} dispatch options.

tag.name: param
tag.description: allowedHours The value represents the allowed hours. Comma separated values for the allowed hours and can be combined with a range of hours. The required format looks like 0,3,5,17-21 as an example. The acceptable values rane is 0..23. Note that the if this argument is not provided, all 24H of the day will be considered as acceptable dispatch hours.

tag.name: param
tag.description: allowedHours The value represents the allowed hours. Comma separated values for the allowed hours and can be combined with a range of hours. The required format looks like 0,3,5,17-21 as an example. The acceptable values rane is 0..23. Note that the if this argument is not provided, all 24H of the day will be considered as acceptable dispatch hours.
